result.execSummary:
The defendant Mila Ivanov was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Sentence credit of 1 day was granted, if imposed.

miscConds.notes:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with The Corners Shopping Center in Brookfield or any of the stores located there.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Complete a Criminal Thinking Course.

Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week).

Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License.

No new law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Cash bail applied to costs. PAID IN FULL.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by Agent.
Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT - STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mila Ivanov

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:57 PM Defendant Mila Ivanov in court.  Attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf Esq in court for Mila Ivanov.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.
Court notes that full restitution has been paid for Count 1 and the items taken in Count 2 were returned in total.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
31 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 1 day if revoked)
-	13 Months of Initial Confinement
-	18 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation: 12 Months
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	No contact with The Corners Shopping Center in Brookfield or any of the stores located there.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Complete a Criminal Thinking Course;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week);
-	Complete 50 hours of community service;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License;
-	No new law violations;

Condition Time: 60 Days Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT - STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DRGOD Surcharge: $ 10.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining financial obligations to be paid immediately after court today. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
